metadata.title: CVE-2014-8176 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The dtls1_clear_queues function in ssl/d1_lib.c in OpenSSL before 0.9.8za,1.0.0 before 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1h frees data structures withoutconsidering that application data can arrive between a ChangeCipherSpecmessage and a Finished message, which allows remote DTLS peers to cause adenial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via unexpected application data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2c-1ubuntu1
openssl - 1.0.2c-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2c-1ubuntu1').
